sub_title: Service Manager Healthcare Informatics Benelux at Philips

profile_positions.description:
Key area of responsibility
- Manage team for Healthcare Informatics (HI) service delivery, including implementation, integration and Care (20+ resources). These cover solutions like IntelliSpace PACS, IntelliSpace Portal, IntelliSpace Cardiovascular, Xper Information Management, IntelliSpace Precision Medicine , IntelliBridge Enterprise and Digital Computational Pathology. 
- Build and maintain training plan for Technical, integration, application and remote support consultants.
- Ensure proper functioning of HI servicedesk including 24x7 on-call duty including escalation 
management.
- Build Level 2 organisation for Digital Computational Pathology (DCP) in Europe and maintain knowledge community across the zones. Assist markets in onboarding DCP L1 service
- Drive HI lifecycyle management process (RfA, RfD, EoL etc) within the Benelux Market.
- Co-create Marketing Plans & BMC processes for HI products.
- Assist in Business development activities around Philips HealthSuite Digital Platform (HSDP) propositions in BeNeLux regarding Diabetes, Oncology & Personal Health Records (e.g. MedMij/PGO).
profile_positions.title: Senior Service Manager Healthcare Informatics Benelux

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for Cardiology IT Service delivery in regions: 
- BeNeLux
- UK & Ireland
- Nordics
- Germany and Alps.

Develop organization: 
- Have the right capabilities, skills & communities
- Align training curriculum to CILS

Improve processes
- Improve handshake processes (FCO, Mercury CAPA, Viper)
- Represent Software Customer Services (SCS) EMEA in NPI process
- Liaise to Business Unit Cardiology Informatics for product improvement
- Statement of Work acceptance 

Deliver financial commitment
- Support the AOP and Rofo process 
- Driving the enablers to realize BMC plans
profile_positions.title: Program Manager Cardiology Informatics Service Delivery North West Europe

profile_positions.description:
Daily Management :
- People management : appraising (PPM), coaching & developing the team
- Coordinate planning & interface with project management for follow-up.
- Escalation Management of Customer Support processes (FPR, Clarify, Mercury & VIPER).
- Incident Management (SLA compliance, call flow).
- Time writing & reporting (Clarity).
- Product management : interface to the BU Cardiology Informatics.

Technical Specialist tasks :
- Install, Implement  & Integrate Cardiology IT systems and test these in the customer’s network environment.
- Update and Upgrade Cardiology IT systems.
- Coordinating role during projects and upgrades.
- Knowledge transfer towards customers and creation of technical documentation.
- ITIL® Problem, Change and Release Management.
- Provide support to Sales and Marketing.
- Technical Product Management with regards to local-for-local solutions.
profile_positions.title: Teamlead Cardiology Informatics

profile_positions.description:
Manage the Factory to Field performance processes, complaints and improvement actions for Healthcare Informatics product line from New Product Introduction onwards. Enable optimal customer satisfaction for the modality by means of simple, efficient utilization of harmonized processes.

Summary:
- Analyze product performance/customer satisfaction results and prioritize improvement actions
- Ensure effective introduction of New Product Introduction within HI environment
- Take ownership and manage product performance escalations
- Team up & share actions with Modality Sales collegues
- Implement best practices as learned from benchmarking
- Ensure compliance with proper use of business processes
- Deliver reporting & analysis & BBS figures
- Maintain the Global Sales and Service community for HI speciality
profile_positions.title: Modality Performance Manager Healthcare Informatics

profile_positions.description:
Gather requirements from Field Service Groups and Business Units to come up with a solution in training. Focus on training expertise focussed on CR (Computed Radiology), CT (Computed Tomography) Radiology and Cardiology Informatics. Develop training material in compliance with factory and field stakeholders.

In addition a large portion of my time is managing improvement projects within the PMS (Philips Medical Systems) Academy. A global training facility spread over 3 campusses (US, Netherlands and Singapore) serving more than 3,500 PMS employees and customers from over 70 countries with over 58 full-time professional instructors.

Didactical skills : 
- Certified Trainer at IBCT (http://www.ibct-global.com/)
- Dreamweaver usage to e-learning creation

Technical Instructor skills: 
- Windows Server/Client, SQL, Unix
- HL7/DICOM connectivity & analytical troubleshooting
- Healthcare IT products such as EasyWeb, EasyAccess, ViewForum, Xcelera & Xcelera Connect, Xper Information Management & Xper Connect
- Computed Tomography (Philips Brilliance CT line) & Quantification workstations (Brilliance Workspace)
- Computed Radiography / Direct X-ray

Project Management skills:
- Developed & Deployed HTML based Electronic Course Material environment for PMS Academy.
- Several improvement projects on improving course feedback system (Best, Singapore, Cleveland campusses)
profile_positions.title: Instructor/developer CR/CT/Healthcare IT & Project Leader

profile_positions.description:
Subject : TriMidia Software Design

Responsible for training software engineers in coding Philips TriMedia VLIW processor using C++ and assembly optimization.
profile_positions.title: Instructor Center of Technical Training (CTT)

profile_positions.description: Service desk activities in assisting software engineers in coding TriMedia VLIW processor. Assisting in C++ development and assembly optimization.
profile_positions.title: Technical Support & Application Design TriMedia
